alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Northern Fulton; Northern Herkimer; Northern Warren; Schoharie; Western Albany; Western Greene; Western Schenectady; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 22 at 10:44PM EDT until March 24 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM WEDNESDAY TO NOON EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Freezing rain accumulations mostly around a tenth of an inch, with up to a quarter of an inch possible over the southern Adirondacks. Very light snow accumulations possible over the Adirondacks. * WHERE...The eastern Catskills, Helderbergs,Schoharie Valley and southern Adirondack mountains in eastern New York. * WHEN...From 8 PM Wednesday to noon EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Untreated surfaces will become icy and slippery. Travel could be difficult, especially Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The best chance for icing will be on untreated surfaces during the early morning on Thursday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
